alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw; Fayette; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 3:26AM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Bitterly Cold Start to the Week... .Arctic air will persist early this week with wind chills ranging from 20 below to 40 below zero. With some daytime temperature increase, wind chills may not be quite as low across parts of Wisconsin during the afternoon hours, but overall, much of this week will be quite cold. ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Mitchell, Howard, Floyd, Chickasaw and Fayette Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 9 AM CST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 AM this morning to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
